abstract: After dripping red ink for almost two years, Citigroup posted a $4.4 billion quarterly profit.
snippet: After dripping red ink for almost two years, Citigroup posted a $4.4 billion quarterly profit.
lead_paragraph: How did Citigroup trounce JPMorgan and Bank of America? On Monday, Citi revealed that it earned $4.4 billion last quarter, its best showing in almost three years. The megabank headed by Vikram S. Pandit not only raked in more profit than its two closest competitors, it also generated a higher return on equity.

headline.print_headline: REUTERS BREAKINGVIEWS; Turning a Corner at Citigroup
